q: Faults are yours to fix, not to curse.
h:
“Faults are yours to fix, not to curse.” —
Colin Powell

q: Hope is not a strategy. Luck is not a factor. Fear is not an option.
h:
“Hope is not a strategy. Luck is not a factor. Fear is not an option.” —
James Cameron

q: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
h:
“I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.” —
Thomas Edison

q: Every defeat, every heartbreak every loss, contains its own seed, its own lesson on how to improve your performance the next time.
h:
“Every defeat, every heartbreak every loss, contains its own seed, its own lesson on how to improve your performance the next time.” —
Og Mandino

q: The ladder of success is best climbed by stepping on the rungs of opportunity.
h:
“The ladder of success is best climbed by stepping on the rungs of opportunity.” —
Ayn Rand

q: Being entirely honest with oneself is a good exercise.
h:
“Being entirely honest with oneself is a good exercise.” —
Sigmund Freud

q: Be fascinated instead of frustrated.
h:
“Be fascinated instead of frustrated.” —
Jim Rohn

q: There is a wisdom of the head, and there is a wisdom of the heart.
h:
“There is a wisdom of the head, and there is a wisdom of the heart.” —
Charles Dickens

q: You are not only responsible for what you say, but also for what you do not say.
h:
“You are not only responsible for what you say, but also for what you do not say. ” —
Martin Luther

q: A very little key will open a very heavy door.
h:
“A very little key will open a very heavy door.” —
Charles Dickens

q: The past is history. It no longer exists, but you are keeping it alive in your mind through your thoughts.  Let it go. It is not serving you.
h:
“The past is history. It no longer exists, but you are keeping it alive in your mind through your thoughts. Let it go. It is not serving you.” —
Sonia Ricotti

q: Short cuts make long delays.
h:
“Short cuts make long delays.” —
J.R.R. Tolkien

q: What we call the beginning is often the end. And to make an end is to make a beginning. The end is where we start from.
h:
“What we call the beginning is often the end. And to make an end is to make a beginning. The end is where we start from.” —
T.S. Eliot

q: It is important that we forgive ourselves for making mistakes. We need to learn from our errors and move on.
h:
“It is important that we forgive ourselves for making mistakes. We need to learn from our errors and move on.” —
Steve Maraboli

q: Confidence is the greatest friend.
h:
“Confidence is the greatest friend.” —
Lao Tzu

q: A lot of people have gone further than they thought they could because someone else thought they could.
h:
“A lot of people have gone further than they thought they could because someone else thought they could.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: It is under the greatest adversity that there exists the greatest potential for doing good, both for oneself and others.
h:
“It is under the greatest adversity that there exists the greatest potential for doing good, both for oneself and others.” —
Dalai Lama

q: Without the rain there would be no rainbow.
h:
“Without the rain there would be no rainbow.” —
Gilbert Chesterton

q: It is children only who enjoy the present; their elders either live on the memory of the past or the hope of the future.
h:
“It is children only who enjoy the present; their elders either live on the memory of the past or the hope of the future.” —
Nicolas Chamfort

q: The goal of an artist is to create the definitive work that cannot be surpassed.
h:
“The goal of an artist is to create the definitive work that cannot be surpassed.” —
George Bernard Shaw

q: Success is getting what you want, happiness is wanting what you get.
h:
“Success is getting what you want, happiness is wanting what you get.” —
W.P. Kinsella

q: We will act consistently with our view of who we truly are, whether that view is accurate or not.
h:
“We will act consistently with our view of who we truly are, whether that view is accurate or not.” —
Tony Robbins

q: Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans.
h:
“Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans.” —
John Lennon

q: We run to win, not just to be in the race.
h:
“We run to win, not just to be in the race. ” —
Vince Lombardi

q: You are free, and that is why you are lost.
h:
“You are free, and that is why you are lost. ” —
Franz Kafka

q: He who is not contented with what he has, would not be contented with what he would like to have.
h:
“He who is not contented with what he has, would not be contented with what he would like to have.” —
Socrates

q: The sun shines upon good and bad alike.
h:
“The sun shines upon good and bad alike.” —
Hans Christian Andersen

q: If you hang out with chickens, you're going to cluck and if you hang out with eagles, you're going to fly.
h:
“If you hang out with chickens, you're going to cluck and if you hang out with eagles, you're going to fly.” —
Steve Maraboli

q: Instead of worrying about what you cannot control, shift your energy to what you can create.
h:
“Instead of worrying about what you cannot control, shift your energy to what you can create.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Don't give up on your dreams, or your dreams will give up on you.
h:
“Don't give up on your dreams, or your dreams will give up on you.” —
John Wooden

q: The season of failure is the best time for sowing the seeds of success.
h:
“The season of failure is the best time for sowing the seeds of success. ” —
Paramahansa Yogananda

q: We never know how high we are till we are called to rise. Then if we are true to form our statures touch the skies.
h:
“We never know how high we are till we are called to rise. Then if we are true to form our statures touch the skies.” —
Emily Dickinson

q: A single act of kindness throws out roots in all directions, and the roots spring up and make new trees.
h:
“A single act of kindness throws out roots in all directions, and the roots spring up and make new trees.” —
Amelia Earhart

q: People tend to complicate their own lives, as if living weren't already complicated enough.
h:
“People tend to complicate their own lives, as if living weren't already complicated enough.” —
Carlos Ruiz Zafon

q: Conscience is a man's compass.
h:
“Conscience is a man's compass. ” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: There's no coming to consciousness without pain
h:
“There's no coming to consciousness without pain” —
Carl Jung

q: Who wishes to fight must first count the cost.
h:
“Who wishes to fight must first count the cost.” —
Sun Tzu

q: Don't let making a living prevent you from making a life.
h:
“Don't let making a living prevent you from making a life.” —
John Wooden

q: The best teacher is experience and not through someone's distorted point of view.
h:
“The best teacher is experience and not through someone's distorted point of view.” —
Jack Kerouac

q: Understanding that rests in what it does not understand is the finest.
h:
“Understanding that rests in what it does not understand is the finest.” —
Zhuangzi

q: We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.
h:
“We suffer more often in imagination than in reality. ” —
Seneca

q: Do what is right, not what is easy, nor what is popular.
h:
“Do what is right, not what is easy, nor what is popular.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Silence is sometimes the best answer
h:
“Silence is sometimes the best answer” —
Dalai Lama

q: Only those who will risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go.
h:
“Only those who will risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go.” —
T.S. Eliot

q: Originality is the fine art of remembering what you hear but forgetting where you heard it.
h:
“Originality is the fine art of remembering what you hear but forgetting where you heard it. ” —
Laurence J. Peter

q: The only people without problems are those in cemeteries.
h:
“The only people without problems are those in cemeteries.” —
Tony Robbins

q: Take into account that great love and great achievements involve great risk.
h:
“Take into account that great love and great achievements involve great risk.” —
Dalai Lama

q: Worry is a waste of emotional reserve.
h:
“Worry is a waste of emotional reserve.” —
Ayn Rand

q: A day wasted on others is not wasted on one's self.
h:
“A day wasted on others is not wasted on one's self.” —
Charles Dickens

q: Everything you look at can become a fairy tale and you can get a story from everything you touch.
h:
“Everything you look at can become a fairy tale and you can get a story from everything you touch.” —
Hans Christian Andersen
